CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| diselenienylbenzothiadiazole (DSeBT) |
| 2,7-carbazole comonomer |
| poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) (PCDSeBT) |
| poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-thiophene-benzothiadiazole) (PCDTBT) |

Explanation:

* "In conclusion" and "This design motif is that" are not material names.
* "replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units" is a description of the modification, not a material name.
* "induces a lower bandgap" and "still maintained" are not material names.
* "superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs" is a description of the property of PCDSeBT, not a material name.
* "1.70 eV" and "1.85 eV" are energy values, not material names.
* "-5.40 eV" is an energy value, not a material name.

These entities refer to material properties of the polymers mentioned in the paragraph. The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to material properties, but rather describe the process used to create the material or the material's relationship to other materials.
